Is this config Crappy? Do I need to upgrade?

item.title: Who Knew this Crappy Config could play TF2
item.dc:creator: D4RKN3SS
item.description:
hypnotek:

Well he cant do much in the way of upgrading for that computer, the graphics card is part of the intel mobile chipset family,telling us that its a laptop. That should run TF2 fine on low-ish settings (I got it to run on an old GeForce 5200 and a 2.5 ghz celeron) but you might consider upgrading sometime soon. Other than your graphics card your machine is fairly ok.

Well i put my vid card at maximum power

Weird thing is aero isnt disabed like all my other games,

Read full topic
item.source: Who Knew this Crappy Config could play TF2

item.title: Who Knew this Crappy Config could play TF2
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
D4RKN3SS:

OS Install Date: Dec 31 1969<------ WTF IS THIS!!!

When they created the OS image they were probably too lazy to set the correct time and date in the bios.

Read full topic
item.source: Who Knew this Crappy Config could play TF2

item.title: Who Knew this Crappy Config could play TF2
item.dc:creator: TheJuraj
item.description:
Get a new card and you’ll be possibly able to play on servers with <20 players.
I’ve got 2Ghz processor too. I can play with decent 20-40 fps on servers with 12-14 players. More players = fps drop.

Yeah, sometimes, when shit’s going up and stuff, i’ve got 10 and less fps.

Edit
Oh, and my card is Ati Radeon HD3650, 512Mb, 128-mbit.

Read full topic
item.source: Who Knew this Crappy Config could play TF2

item.title: Who Knew this Crappy Config could play TF2
item.dc:creator: hypnotek
item.description:
Well he cant do much in the way of upgrading for that computer, the graphics card is part of the intel mobile chipset family,telling us that its a laptop. That should run TF2 fine on low-ish settings (I got it to run on an old GeForce 5200 and a 2.5 ghz celeron) but you might consider upgrading sometime soon. Other than your graphics card your machine is fairly ok.

item.title: Who Knew this Crappy Config could play TF2
item.dc:creator: eternalness
item.description:
Its called hyperthreading, it makes one core act as two. Also im pretty sure HDR is only availible in DX9 mode.

item.title: Who Knew this Crappy Config could play TF2
item.dc:creator: Skilgannon
item.description:
This setup will run TF2 in dxlevel 80 with AA, HDR, colour correct, motion blur and vertical sync off, so with a new gfx card, yours should handle it quite nicely.

Manufacturer:
Dell Computer Corporation
Processor:
Intel® Pentium® 4 CPU 3.00GHz (2 CPUs)
Memory:
2558MB RAM
Hard Drive:
120 GB
Video Card:
NVIDIA GeForce 7300 GT
Monitor:
Plug and Play Monitor
Sound Card:
SoundMAX Digital Audio
Speakers/Headphones:
Razer Carcharias Headset
Keyboard:
USB Root Hub
Mouse:
USB Root Hub
Mouse Surface:
Mat with rest
Operating System:
Windows XP Professional (5.1, Build 2600) Service Pack 2 (2600.xpsp_sp2_gdr.090206-1233)
Motherboard:
No idea
Computer Case:
Standard Dell Desktop I suppose…

EDIT: Inb4 d00d u got a d3ll…
EDIT 2: It says two cpu’s, it’s actually one.

Read full topic
item.source: Who Knew this Crappy Config could play TF2

item.title: Who Knew this Crappy Config could play TF2
item.dc:creator: Phat
item.description:
1.Get a new graphic card - this is the most important thing
2.Overclock that processor (or get a new one)
3.Also your HDD might be slow but there is no info on that so you may have to get that too

Your system is not that bad i guess it’s quite decent lacks a graphic card for gaming

Read full topic
